{{Infobox station | style= | name=Gaziemir Railway Station | image= | image_size=300 | image_caption= | address= | line= | other= | platform=2 | tracks=4 | electrified=2001 | parking=Yes | bicycle= | passengers= 637,406 | pass_year= 2011 | pass_percent= | pass_system= Ä°ZBAN | opened=1858 | rebuilt=2006 | closed= | ADA= | baggage_check= | code= | owned=[[Turkish State Railways|TCDD]] | zone= | services= | mpassengers= }} The '''Gaziemir Railway Station''' (''Gaziemir GarÄ±'' in [[Turkish language|Turkish]]) is a railway station in [[Gaziemir]]. ==History== The station was opened in 1856, when the [[Oriental Railway Company]] built its line to Gaziemir. The line was then continued to [[AydÄ±n]] and in 1866, the station was opened to regular passenger service. The ORC was taken over by the [[Turkish State Railways]] in 1935 and the station became theirs. The station served as the terminus for trains headed to Ä°zmir since 2006, due to construction of the [[Åirinyer Rail Tunnel]]. In 2009 however trains once again continued into Ä°zmir. ==Services==
